div.p: Friderich, by the grace of God, Count Palatine of the Rhine, Arch-Seneschal and Elector of the Holy Roman Empire, Duke in Bavaria, etc.

Our greetings beforehand, honorable, dear, special one, your letters, which you have sent to us several times for quite some time now, have been well received, as well as your faithful diligence, effort, and work, which you have dedicated to the embattled churches of Christ for many years, have been praised for the best, and we first of all graciously thank you for your humble Christian affection, and we also want to be mindful of means and ways so that you may one day perceive and find our gracious, thankful will in action. May the dear God keep you in long-lasting health and ability for the good of His church, and you should expect all gracious will from us.
Given in Augsburg on the 19th of May in the year 1566. Friderich, Count Palatine, Elector, etc.
To the honorable, our dear special Heinrich Bullinger, church servant in Zurich.
"From the Imperial Diet in Augsburg, Elector's gracious letter 1566."
